intro: Argostemma humile, commonly known as the slender argostemma, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a tubular corolla. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks.
